definition: (literary) I trust you have been well since we last met
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: After the triumphant return, can again unscarred?
sentences.chinese: 而凯旋归来后，是否可以别来无恙？

sentences.english: I always believe that. Because I am only a child.
sentences.chinese: 我们都不知道其实我们一直别来无恙着。

sentences.english: Well, hello world, how've you been?

definition: honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
we are honored by your presence

pinyin: ren2 sheng1 he2 chu4 bu4 xiang1 feng2

definition: I'm sure we'll meet again some day. (idiom)/Hope to see you again.
I have been enlightened by your teaching (humble)
(said by departing guest) no need to see me out
